ai.summary: Castle Trail at Castle Ward is a gentle 4.9 km hike through the Castle Ward estate in Northern Ireland, UK. Rated easy, it weaves along well-maintained paths around the historic castle and manor, making it suitable for families and walkers of all ages.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat to gently undulating estate paths and gravel tracks. Expect a mix of surfaced paths, grassy sections, and occasional uneven stones near historic features. Can be muddy after rain, so good footwear is advised.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths, wear sturdy footwear, and check weather conditions before you go. Bring water, supervise children, and be mindful of muddy sections after rain. Respect property boundaries and local wildlife.
recommended_gear: Comfortable, sturdy walking shoes or light hiking boots
Layered clothing and a light rain jacket
Map, guidebook, or downloaded offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn; best in late spring to early autumn when paths are drier and daylight is longer.
